reference.title: Cover Page
reference.shortdesc: This is the cover page with general information about the elements and how I've used them in this project.

section.title: indexterm
section.p:
Used a combination of indexterm, index-see, and index-see-also to create an index of
8 regular entries
20 nested entries
7 synonymous entries

section.title: Conditional processing and flagging schemes
section.p: Created .ditaval file to filter for general and expert user and exclude novice users. For platforms, it includes Windows, excludes Mac, and flags Linux with absurd colors.

section.title: Chunking
section.p: Walls of text or unmanageable lists were broken down into sections, tables, or topics according to concept, reference, or task information types.

section.title: href
section.p: If the source material linked to other URLs outside the document, they were included in the DITA as href.
If the source material linked to another spot in the document that was not transformed for Project 2, these also became href linking back to the source PDF.

section.title: xref
section.p: If the source material linked to another spot in the document that was transformed, xref was used in the DITA. This included linking to other topics, sections, and individual steps.
If the source material linked to another spot in the document that was not transformed for Project 2, these became href linking back to the source PDF.

section.title: conkeyref
section.p: Used for inserting image content.

section.title: reltable
section.p: Linked topics of relevance together.

section.title: related-links
section.p: I used related links to both topics as well as elements within topics. In container topics, I used related-links and linklist to create a mini TOC.

section.title: audience
section.p: I believe the audience to be a general administrator tasked with installing the IBM StoredIQ. This information is in the metadata.

section.title: platform
section.p: I made the assumption that the platform was on Windows, and inserted this into the metadata.

section.title: product
section.p: The product is the IBM StoredIQ, and it was inserted into the metadata.

section.title: note
section.p: Notes had type and importance attributes set according to their gravity and purpose identified in the source content.

section.title: examples
section.p: I used this element to wrap around examples in the source content.

section.title: prolog
section.p: I included copyright information, other product information, and created dates for versioning purposes. I assume for later iterations, the "modified" attribute will be added to the dates.

section.title: cmdname
section.p: Used to tag command names in the software.

section.title: substep
section.p: Used to break down steps into series of actions.

section.title: stepresult
section.p: Used to provide the outcome of a step so the user understands what is to be expected.

section.title: info
section.p: Used inside steps to provide additional information.

section.title: postreq
section.p: Ysed to describe the steps or tasks that the user should do after the successful completion of the current task.

section.title: prereq
section.p: Used to inform the user about the the things the user needs to know or do before starting the current task.

section.title: userinput
section.p: Used for anything I interpretted as elements the user can change or input, such as usernames, passwords, and text values.

section.title: uicontrol
section.p: Used for anything I interpretted as interactive elements within the user interface.

section.title: menucascade
section.p: Used for multiple uicontrol elements in sequential order.

section.title: codeph
section.p: Used to wrap snippets of program code inline with the content.

section.title: codeblock
section.p: Used to wrap blocks of program code.

section.title: glossgroup
section.p: I created a glossgroup to demonstrate that I understand how to group multiple glossentry elements into one topic.

section.title: glossentry
section.p: I created glossentry topics and mapped them into the project map to show I understand they can be mapped as well. I understand they can be mapped into a glossary.ditamap, but I did not want to have 2 glossaries since I also created a glossgroup.

section.title: topichead
section.p: Used to create letter sections for the glossary.

section.title: abbreviated-form
section.p: Used to call out instances of glossary terms.

section.title: parml
section.p: Used parml, plentry, pt, and pd to list terms and definitions described as parameters.
